name: Wing Lake Capital Partners
desc: Wing Lake Capital Partners is a Farmington Hills, MI-based alternative lending and business advisory firm specializing in MCA debt consolidation and growth capital. Founded by Shaya Baum, the firm evolved from Franklin Capital (est. 2004) and operates two funds: the Franklin Fund (~$100M, focused on restructuring distressed MCA debt) and the Capstone Fund ($50M, growth capital for businesses graduating out of MCA dependency). Wing Lake receives approximately 800 referrals weekly from MCA companies, has funded 75+ companies totaling $100M+, and reports ~$25M in annual revenue. The firm partnered with Rocky Mountain Bank (Wyoming) in 2020, expanding its lending capabilities. Wing Lake claims a 90% success rate in helping client companies avoid bankruptcy. The team of ~13 employees spans Farmington Hills HQ and remote positions, with active presence at deBanked CONNECT conferences and the Revenue Based Finance Coalition.

news.h: Wing Lake Team at deBanked CONNECT Miami 2025
news.d: Wing Lake Capital sent a team to deBanked CONNECT Miami 2025 and sponsored the drink cart for the Revenue Based Finance Coalition, signaling active industry engagement.

news.h: Back to Business Podcast Season 2 Launch
news.d: Sarah Annas launched new episodes of the Back to Business podcast including an interview with Emmy-winning news anchor turned PR exec Robin Schwartz, covering storytelling in business.

news.h: Devotion Hospice: From MCA Debt to Successful Exit
news.d: Wing Lake published a case study showing how they helped Devotion Hospice resolve financial challenges, scale to 800 patients and 165 employees, and achieve a successful acquisition exit.

news.h: Shaya Baum Co-founds Tents of Two Brothers Coalition
news.d: Baum co-founded the Tents of Two Brothers Coalition with Mike Kassab, a nonprofit leading trips to Israel to foster peace and bridge cultural divides across the Middle East.

news.h: Shaya Baum Named EY Entrepreneur of the Year Michigan & NW Ohio
news.d: Baum won the EY Entrepreneur of the Year for Michigan and Northwest Ohio and was named a national finalist, recognized for disrupting the MCA restructuring industry.

news.h: Wing Lake Capital Launches $50M Capstone Growth Fund
news.d: Wing Lake announced the Capstone Fund with $50M from existing Franklin Fund investors, shifting focus from distressed restructuring to growth capital for businesses ready to scale.

leaders.bg: Wayne State University accounting graduate (2006-2009). Co-founded and sold a NY-based tax prep company at age 19. Joined Franklin Capital as accountant in 2004, became CEO by 2010. Launched debt fund in 2017, merged into Wing Lake Capital Partners in 2019. Won EY Entrepreneur of the Year Michigan/NW Ohio 2022 and was national finalist. Named Detroit Jewish News 36 Under 36 (2021). Featured in Authority Magazine's 'Meet the Disruptors' series. Co-founded Tents of Two Brothers Coalition (Israel peacebuilding nonprofit) and Firefly Advocates (wrongful conviction innocence project that freed a man after 12 years). Involved in 100+ company restructurings. Receives ~800 MCA referrals per week. Describes Wing Lake as a 'restructuring firm that also writes a check.'

University of Michigan graduate (Finance, Financial Accounting & Reporting, Controllership). Soviet Jewish immigrant from Novosibirsk, Siberia — came to Metro Detroit in 1995 at age 6 with parents (father held PhD in mechanical engineering, mother MS in civil engineering). Career path: Masco Corporation (2011+, roles in corporate tax, internal audit, corporate development, rising to Senior Auditor), then Veoneer (Manager, Internal Audit). Also founded an IT support company that grew to 11 employees serving 500+ clients daily. Board member of Garrett's Space (youth mental health/suicide prevention nonprofit) and Hebrew Free Loan of Metro Detroit (youngest board member at 32, joined 2018). Values data accuracy and process rigor in underwriting.
hooks: Youngest Hebrew Free Loan board member

leaders.bg: Miami University Farmer School of Business graduate (Marketing & Interactive Media Studies). Previously Account Manager at Insight Global (IT/finance staffing). Hosts Wing Lake's 'Back to Business' podcast on Buzzsprout/Apple Podcasts — features business leaders in regulated industries with guests including Emmy-winning journalist Robin Schwartz and Wing Lake's own leadership team. Appeared on deBanked TV red carpet interview representing Wing Lake. Also a Certified Yoga Instructor (Chagrin Yoga Studio). Focused on building broker relationships and empowering entrepreneurs through content.

Michigan State University graduate (Marketing). Midwest transplant now based in Southern California. Career spanned video production, fine arts, and real estate before entering business lending in 2019. Joined Wing Lake in May 2020 as Director of Business Development, managing and growing broker relationships. Featured on Wing Lake's Back to Business podcast (Episode 4) discussing remote work, team dynamics, and work-life balance. Represents Wing Lake at deBanked CONNECT conferences (Las Vegas, Miami). Active in growing Wing Lake's ISO/broker channel.
hooks: Featured on Back to Business podcast
